sentences.en: All was real vitality, real warmth, real incarnation.
sentences.cn: 全都是实在的生气, 实在的温暖, 实在的血肉.

sentences.en: Christ was an incarnation of Sananda.
He believed he had been a prince in a previous incarnation.
He believes that his life will be better in his next incarnation.
sentences.cn: 他认为他下辈子会生活得更好.

sentences.en: He is the incarnation of peace.
However, this latest incarnation is nothing like its old.
sentences.cn: 但是, 这个最新的喇叭变体一点也不像它的雏形.

sentences.en: Later on , the tortoise was regarded as the incarnation of god.
sentences.cn: 宣武后来被誉为神的化身.

sentences.en: She began recalling a series of previous incarnations.
sentences.cn: 她开始回想起种种前世化身。

sentences.en: She is a perfect incarnation of glamour.
She is the very incarnation of generosity.
She was the incarnation of wisdom.
She's the very incarnation of goodness.
The leading dancer is the incarnation of grace.
sentences.cn: 那位主要舞蹈演员简直是美的化身.

sentences.en: The miser was an incarnation of greed.
sentences.cn: 那个守财奴是贪婪的化身.

sentences.en: This is because each incarnation has less adverse karma, requiring less attention.
sentences.cn: 这是因为每一次轮回的不利羯磨在减少, 所需要的关注也更少.

sentences.en: You may be fated to have a very influential incarnation.
sentences.cn: 你可能注定是一种非常有权势的化身.

sentences.en: You must have been kind - hearted in your previous incarnation.
sentences.cn: 前世的你,一定是个善良的人.

words.tran_cn: 化身的；人体化的；肉色的
体现；使…具体化；使实体化

trans.tran_en: An incarnation is an instance of being alive on earth in a particular form. Some religions believe that people have several incarnations in different forms.
